meanings.definition: Not made docile or submissive; not domesticated.
meanings.sent1: The lion in the jungle was untame and roamed freely.
meanings.sent2: The untame horse refused to be ridden by anyone.
meanings.sent3: The untame squirrel kept stealing nuts from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: Her untame spirit could not be confined by societal norms.
meanings.sent5: The untame wind howled through the night, unsettling all who heard it.

meanings.definition: Not controlled or restrained; wild or unruly.
meanings.sent1: The untame river flooded its banks during the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The untame child ran around the playground with endless energy.
meanings.sent3: The untame garden grew wild with flowers of all colors.
meanings.sent4: His untame emotions spilled over, causing chaos in the room.
meanings.sent5: The untame storm raged on, shaking the very foundations of the house.
